alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Decatur; Lucas; Marion; Monroe; Warren; Wayne (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 06 at 1:46PM CDT until June 06 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Monroe County in south central Iowa... Lucas County in south central Iowa... Northeastern Decatur County in south central Iowa... Southern Marion County in south central Iowa... Northern Wayne County in south central Iowa... Eastern Clarke County in south central Iowa... Southeastern Warren County in south central Iowa... * Until 230 PM CDT. * At 145 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Indianola to 8 miles west of Melcher-Dallas to 6 miles southwest of Osceola, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Milo, Lacona and Sandyville around 150 PM CDT. Pleasantville, Melcher-Dallas and Williamson around 200 PM CDT. Garden Grove around 205 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Le Roy, Knoxville, Knoxville Raceway, Humeston, Derby, Knoxville Municipal Airport, Lovilia, Corydon, Allerton, Bussey, Harvey, Hamilton, Marysville and Millerton. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 27 and 35. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Clarke; Decatur; Lucas; Marion; Monroe; Warren; Wayne
